page.title: 04ROCHE CHEMICALS, DALRY
page.content: The main purpose of the Dalry factory is to supply the world market with {Vitamins}and other fine chemicals for the pharmaceutical industry. With 750 workers, it is a major employer. {The Swiss Company}began making Vitamin A here in 1957 on a 7 acre site. By 1972 it had expanded to 21 acres, with plants making Vitamins B1 and B5 and a range of chemicals. In 1983 a large new complex was completed for the manufacture of Vitamin C. Costing Â£150 million, it increased the site size to 46 acres. A railway siding was built to bring in coal directly to fire the plant's own power house. Sophisticated chemical engineering techniques are combined with high standards of working conditions and facilities. Over 90% of the output is exported, for the pharmaceutical, food and animal feed industries.
